1.text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.

2.text: And the earth was without form, and void; and darkness was upon the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God moved upon the face of the waters.

3.text: And God said, Let there be light: and there was light.

4.text: And God saw the light, that it was good: and God divided the light from the darkness.

5.text: And God called the light Day, and the darkness he called Night. And the evening and the morning were the first day.

1.text: Thus the heavens and the earth were finished, and all the host of them.

2.text: And on the seventh day God ended his work which he had made; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had made.

3.text: And God blessed the seventh day, and sanctified it: because that in it he had rested from all his work which God created and made.

1.text: Now the serpent was more subtil than any beast of the field which the Lord God had made. And he said unto the woman, Yea, hath God said, Ye shall not eat of every tree of the garden?

2.text: And the woman said unto the serpent, We may eat of the fruit of the trees of the garden:

3.text: But of the fruit of the tree which is in the midst of the garden, God hath said, Ye shall not eat of it, neither shall ye touch it, lest ye die.
